text: Stewart Henry SternStewart Henry Stern at the University of Virginia (March 22, 1922 â€“ February 2, 2015) was a two-time Oscar-nominated and Emmy award winning American screenwriter. He was best known for writing the screenplay for the iconic movie Rebel Without a Cause (1955), starring James Dean. ==References== ==Other websites== * Category:Emmy Award winners Category:1922 births Category:2015 deaths Category:Deaths from brain cancer Category:American screenwriters Category:Writers from Iowa
